contentrichtext.text: {{Koizumi Cabinet}} {{nihongo|'''Yasufumi Tanahashi'''|棚橋 泰文|Tanahashi Yasufumi|extra=born February 11, 1963}} is a Japanese politician. He was the [[Minister of State for Science and Technology Policy]], the [[Minister of State for Food Safety]] and the [[Minister of State for Information Technology]] in [[Japanese Prime Minister]] [[Junichiro Koizumi]]'s Cabinet. Graduated from the [[University of Tokyo]] with [[Bachelor of Arts|B.A.]] in [[private law]], Tanahashi was first elected to the [[House of Representatives of Japan|House of Representatives]] in 1996 after practising as a [[lawyer]]. ==External links== * http://www.kantei.go.jp/foreign/koizumidaijin/040927/18tanahashi_e.html {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Tanahashi, Yasufumi | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Japanese politician | DATE OF BIRTH = February 11, 1963 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Tanahashi, Yasufumi}} [[Category:Government ministers of Japan]] [[Category:1963 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Members of the House of Representatives of Japan]] {{Japan-politician-stub}}
